After Rodimus had spoken, a rain of laserfire swept at Cyclonus. A
moment l=
ater, Remus calmly arrived at the scene and interposed himself
between the =
leader and the hunter. He said nothing, but his eyes shone
an unearthly yel=
low-gold color.

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Richard Allen <roborick007@=
...> wrote:
>
> ::Rodimus Prime/Kup::
> 
> Rodimus and Kup high five each o=
ther as the Sweeps fall. Their
attention is then diverted to Cyclonus.
> 
>=
 As the Sweeps lash out at Kup he opens up a volley of laser rifle
fire bef=
ore diving back under the surface to avoid the attacks. He has
to dive deep=
 to avoid the powerful cannon shots so it will take him a
moment to return =
to the surface.
> 
> Rodimus ignores the Sweeps as he stares down Cyclonus =
eye to eye.
The voice chilled him. It was the same. He couldn't tell if thi=
s was
the same Cyclonus from the Great War but the voice was the same and i=
t
scared him. Now was the time to be the brave leader.
> 
> Rodimus: Cyclon=
us, if you know anything about me then you should
know that threats will no=
t change my resolve. I am an Autobot. I have
spent thousands of years facin=
g evil in the universe and I do not back
down from it. The Maximals will be=
 willing to die to protect the
Matrix from Unicron. There is no way I'll ev=
er hand it over. You want
it so bad then you call off the attack. We go to =
a deserted area and
fight it out. Now if you are the same Cyclonus I knew t=
hen you will be
to coward to agree. Are you?!
> 
> Super Cyclonus <supercyc=
lonus@...> wrote:                               
>  OOC: If I have forgotte=
n anyone or missed anything let me know. I like
>  to catch it all, but the=
re are a lot of details. I apologize in
>  advance.
>  
>  BIC:
>  
>  The =
air is becoming positively filled with the acrid smell of laser
>  fire and=
 the bite of acid. The skies above are still thick with sweeps,
>  but for =
those keeping count, the number of them is beginning to
>  diminish. Whatev=
er the various defenders are doing it is beginning to
>  take its toll on t=
he minions. But so far their onslaught continues
>  without let up!
>  
>  =
Sweeps around the base continue a holding pattern above and beyond the
>  d=
oor, either out of range or the field of view of the door's cannons
>  and =
defenders. They continue concentrating firepower around the base,
>  their =
heavy lasers and disintegration beams bathing its shields in
>  scintillati=
ng colors. Blasts from Guardia and the gate guards continue
>  to keep the =
sweeps at bay, and even succeed in bringing down a few. As
>  a result the =
sweeps redouble thier efforts to stay out of the direct
>  line of fire and=
 attempt to harass anyone trying to leave through the
>  doors. (OOC: No th=
e sweeps are not at the doors, but anyone trying to
>  come out may have to=
 face their firepower from an oblique angle. The
>  sweeps may not be able =
to totally block the door, but they can make
>  exits difficult. IE: people=
 should be able to leave, but should pose
>  having to dodge cannon fire an=
d such) 
>  
>  As for Salveo, his scans for any other minions other than t=
he ones in
>  the air, or otherwise already accounted for come up negative.=
 However
>  as far as most of his sensors are concerned the sweeps are not =
there,
>  only infrared picks up a slight vapor trail from their exhaust wh=
en
>  they engage engines in heavy thrust, or visual cameras as they pan ov=
er
>  their fields of view. 
>  
>  Somewhat nearby:
>  
>  Several sweeps =
go up in an amazing blast of fire and pyrotechnics as
>  Lord Perseus' long=
 black rifle lights into the air. Several charred and
>  smoking frames fal=
l from the skies and hit the streets below! For the
>  rest of the sweeps t=
he reaction is swift as they swing away from the
>  fortifications for a mo=
ment and circle around trying to find an
>  opening. For the moment Perseus=
' immediate area is free, however the
>  walls of his fortification still r=
umble and debris continue to fall
>  around him as laser fire targets his l=
ocation from sides he cannot yet
>  defend! 
>  
>  In the air above:
>  
>=
  Cyclonus turned away from Ravenchief's as the Maximal fell away from
>  h=
im, the expression on his face giving no hint to his inner thoughts.
>  Ins=
tead he turns his attention to his true prey ...   
>  
>  On the streets b=
elow:
>   
>  As Ravenchief pulls himself out of his fall and swings up, tw=
o sweeps
>  move in his direction led by a slightly larger one. "Ahhhh, so =
we meet
>  again. I have come to return the favor!" Laughter rings out as l=
aser
>  fire opens up from Scourge and soon enough from the sweeps beside h=
im.
>  (OOC: I know Windlord is in route, but not sure how close he is)
>  =
Near the waters:
>  
>  At the water below:
>  
>  Below near the water the=
 combined firepower of Kup, Doc and Rodimus
>  Prime are enough to finish o=
ff the few remaining sweeps that menace
>  them. Sending several smoking an=
d charred wrecks to a wet grave beneath
>  the ocean waves. 
>  
>  However=
 their respite is short indeed as Cyclonus and nearly a half a
>  dozen swe=
eps move over the railing floating down to the waterfront,
>  perhaps the v=
ery sweeps that scattered to avoid Cyclonus' earlier
>  missile attack have=
 returned. Now they circled Cyclonus, like air bourn
>  lions waiting for t=
he command to attack! 
>  
>  Cyclonus looks down, and with a gesture from =
him the Sweeps swirled
>  forward, their cannons lashing out at Doc and Kup=
, even as Cyclonus
>  continued is decent. 
>  
>  "Rodimus Prime!" The old=
 timber of Cyclonus' voice resonated against
>  the cliff walls. "You have =
only one choice ahead of you now." 
>  
>  Perhaps this is the same Cyclonu=
s of old, perhaps not, but as he
>  descended, the very power he radiated s=
howed something there was
>  something newa bout him. This is NOT the Cyclo=
nus that served under
>  Galvatron. The reformat he and Scourge had undergo=
ne changed them
>  somehow, and it is as if Cyclonus has been fully unleash=
ed, and finally
>  brought to his fullest potential. 
>  
>  His voice deep=
ened as he continued, "You will give me the Matrix now,
>  or I will lay wa=
ste to you and this entire city and take it from your
>  smoking frame!"
